question: Which state government launched the Orundoi scheme to empower women by transferring money directly to their bank accounts?
explanation: The Orundoi Scheme has been launched by Assam government in 29 districts across the state. Through this scheme, the government seeks to empower women by transferring a minimum amount of Rs.830 each month directly to the bank accounts of the nominated female head of the household. More than 18 lakh beneficiaries have already been selected and this number is expected to reach 22 lakhs after the inclusion of districts in the Bodoland Territorial Area.
